text: What's up, you guys? Take another look at roaring kiddie's position from yesterday, because I was in the middle of making a video. He dropped his position and I shared a hypothesis that I don't think is accurate. So I want to walk through what I'm seeing, what it could mean, and essentially why nobody can tell definitively what's going on here. Now, a couple of things. You guys have been sharing so much of the background of roaring kiddie, the way he behaves, which is actually really useful for me. And one of the things you guys said is, hey, he seems to exercise his options lock. He'd take another look and absolutely. And as we take a look at this, it absolutely could be the case, but it's kind of a bit of a stretch in different ways, depending on the scenario we're looking at, but some of them are very plausible. So let's quickly recap what his position was on the 10th of June, which is long 5 million shares at 21.274. And he was long 120,000 of the 20 calls at 5.67 4 cents. Now, a couple of things right out of the gate. These are big positions. When you're trading 5 million shares, 120,000 contracts of options, you don't just enter a single order to get into that position. It's something that you scale into over time. And the reason being is you don't want to bid yourself up. The other thing is in order
